Name: Shabti of Mentuhotep
Description: Blue-glazed faience shabti with long false beard at the chin, emblem of divinity, and a crudely incised column of hieroglyphs down the front, identifying the owner as 'the Osiris the god's servant of Amun, scribe of divine offerings of Amun, Mentuhotep'. This would have been one of a large set of figures intended to carry out any heavy labour required of the dead man in the next world.
